content: little cthulhu pikku-cthulhu pattern and pictures by eeva saviranta translated by elina norros with additions from translation by pelagia by making this little cthulhu you ll surely be eaten first cthulhu brings joy and is an excellent conversation piece at parties for who wouldn t want to have the ancient great as a mascot pattern is originally published in ulla 3/06 http //www ullaneule net/0306/ohjeet_cthulhu html supplies 2 mm hook u s b/1 50 g sport weight/5 ply cotton yarn green and blue yarn used to make the cthulhu in the picture is mayflower viola stuffing black embroidery floss tapestry needle size height 10 cm pattern cthulhu s head body hands and legs are crocheted in the round head chain 10 sts join to first single_crochet continue working in round increase 1 single_crochet on both sides of the head 8 times 1 time on both sides/round until you have 26 single_crochet total try to keep the increases on the same spot every round increase always on forehead and keep 4 single_crochet between increased sts when you have 26 single_crochet total start decreasing start from the forehead sc3tog on 6 rounds then continue decreasing as usual decrease until the hole is shut fasten_off and stuff body use the neck stitches as a base for crocheting the body starting from the neck work 3 rounds repeating *inc1sc inc2sc* until you have 30 single_crochet total work in the round until the body is a bit longer than the head then start decreasing decrease until the hole is almost shut stuff the body and decrease again until the hole is completely shut fasten_off and weave in ends hands and legs *chain 10 sts join to first single_crochet work in round until the length is 3/4 of the head decrease until the hole is shut fasten_off stuff and sew to body * repeat 4 times tentacles starting from the bottom of the head chain 10 sts pull the yarn through cthulhu s jaw leave 10 cm tail and chain approx 3-5 cm more cut the yarn and weave in ends repeat 4 times or until the head looks good weave the tails of chains inside the tentacles wings start the right side wing from the backside of the body in the middle and slightly to the right attach the yarn to the body and chain 8 sts using both the yarn and the tail turn around work the row back and add 1 single_crochet on the body below the starting point leave the tail and turn around work 5 single_crochet and chain 3 sts more turn around work 1 slip_stitch on the body turn around work 3 single_crochet and chain 3 sts more turn around work all single_crochet s and using 1 single_crochet join to body weave in ends work the other wing as a mirror image embroider cthulhu s eyes with black thread
